sen.j: 分部 光貞（わけべ みつさだ、文化 (元号)13年（1816年）- 明治3年4月12日 (旧暦)（1870年5月12日））は、近江国大溝藩の第11代藩主。
sen.e: Mitsusada WAKEBE (1816 - May 12, 1870) was the 11th lord of the Omizo Domain, Omi Province.
Mitsusada WAKEBE (1816 - May 12, 1870) was the 11th lord of the Omizo clan in Omi Province.
sen.cmt: 大溝藩の藩主→lord of the Omizo clan[この場合の「藩」は、人の集団なので、用語リストの指示に従い、"clan"としました]
sen.e: Mitsusada WAKEBE (1816 - May 12, 1870) was the 11th lord of the Omizo clan in Omi Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: He was the 12th head of WAKEBE family.
He was the 12th head of the Wakebe family.
sen.cmt: 分部家を、"the Wakebe family"に変更しました。
sen.e: He was the 12th head of the Wakebe family.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 上野国安中藩主・板倉勝尚 (安中藩主)の次男。
sen.e: He was the second son of Katsunao ITAKURA, the lord of Annaka Domain in Kozuke Province.
He was the second son of Katsunao ITAKURA, the lord of Annaka clan in Kozuke Province.
sen.cmt: 安中藩の藩主→lord of the Annaka clan[この場合の「藩」は、人の集団なので、用語リストの指示に従い、"clan"としました]
sen.e: He was the second son of Katsunao ITAKURA, the lord of Annaka clan in Kozuke Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 子に分部光謙（次男）、娘（溝口直正正室）。
sen.e: His second son was Mitsuroni WAKEBE and his daughter (became the lawful wife of Naomasa MIZOGUCHI).
He had children including Mitsuroni WAKEBE (second son) and a daughter (the lawful wife of Naomasa MIZOGUCHI).
sen.cmt: 「子に」とあるので、"He had children including"としました。また、不必要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: He had children including Mitsuroni WAKEBE (second son) and a daughter (the lawful wife of Naomasa MIZOGUCHI).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 官位は従五位上、若狭国守。
sen.e: His official court rank was Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade), and he served as Wakasa no kuni no kami (Governor of Wakasa Province).
He held the office of Governor of Wakasa Province and rose to the rank of Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
sen.cmt: 用語リストのレビュー結果を参照し、変更しました。若狭国守→Governor of Wakasa Province[作業指示書一式の"Dos and Don'ts for the Kyoto Project"第3項目、Be careful not to "romanize" Japanese terms unnecessarily、に従い、変更しました]
sen.e: He held the office of Governor of Wakasa Province and rose to the rank of Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: His childhood name was Toranosuke.
His childhood name was Toranosuke.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: His childhood name was Toranosuke.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 先代藩主・分部光寧の養嗣子となり、天保2年（1831年）3月10日、光寧の隠居により後を継いだ。
sen.e: Mitsusada became an adopted heir of the former lord of domain Mitsuyasu WAKEBE and succeeded to his position due to his retirement on March 10, 1831.
Mitsusada became an adopted heir of Mitsuyasu WAKEBE, the former lord, and on April 22, 1831, he succeeded to Mitsuyasu's position due to his retirement.
sen.cmt: became の前のスペースを一つ削除しました。天保2年（1831年）3月10日→April 22, 1831[旧暦表記でしたので、新暦に変更しました。また、文尾にあると、「光寧が天保2年（1831年）3月10日に隠居した」との意味にもとれるので、"and"の後に置きました]
sen.e: Mitsusada became an adopted heir of Mitsuyasu WAKEBE, the former lord, and on April 22, 1831, he succeeded to Mitsuyasu's position due to his retirement.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 文久3年（1863年）の八月十八日の政変では京都の守備を務めた。
sen.e: In Coup of August 18, he was in charge of defencing Kyoto.
In the Coup of August 18 (old lunar calendar; referring to September 30 according to new calendar), 1863, he was in charge of securing Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 文久3年（1863年）の八月十八日の政変→Coup of August 18 (old lunar calendar; referring to September 30 according to new calendar), 1830[八月十八日は旧暦なので、参考までに新暦を追記し、"in 1863"が抜けていたので、補いました]京都の守備→securing Kyoto
sen.e: In the Coup of August 18 (old lunar calendar; referring to September 30 according to new calendar), 1863, he was in charge of securing Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その功績を孝明天皇に賞賛されて、金子を与えられている。
sen.e: Emperor Komei gave him reward money to praise his great achievement.
He was granted reward money by the Emperor Komei for his achievements.
sen.cmt: その功績を賞賛されて→for his achievements[簡潔な表現としました]
sen.e: He was granted reward money by the Emperor Komei for his achievements.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 明治2年（1869年）の版籍奉還で藩知事となるが、翌年4月12日に55歳で死去し、後を次男の光謙が継いだ。
sen.e: Although Mitsusada became Governor of the Domain due to Hanseki hokan (Returning of domains and the people living in them to the Emperor) in 1869, he died on April 12 in the following year at the age of 55, so his second son Mitsunori succeeded to his position.

Although he became the governor of domain as a result of returning lands and people to the emperor in 1869, Mitsusada died on May 12 in the following year at the age of 55, and his second son, Mitsunori, succeeded to his position.
sen.cmt: 版籍奉還で→as a result of returning lands and people to the emperor藩知事→governor of domain4月12日→May 12[旧暦表記でしたので、新暦に変更しました]
sen.e: Although he became the governor of domain as a result of returning lands and people to the emperor in 1869, Mitsusada died on May 12 in the following year at the age of 55, and his second son, Mitsunori, succeeded to his position.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 法号：大亮院殿橒嶺道峻大居士。
sen.e: His Hogo (posthumous Buddhist name) is 大亮院殿橒嶺道峻大居士.
sen.cmt: 大亮院殿橒嶺道峻大居士→読み方不明
sen.e: Posthumous Buddhist name: 大亮院殿橒嶺道峻大居士 (pronunciation unknown)
sen.cmt: 法号「大亮院殿橒嶺道峻大居士」の読み方が不明なので、(pronunciation unknown) を追記しました。
sen.e: Posthumous Buddhist name: 大亮院殿橒嶺道峻大居士
sen.cmt: (pronunciation unknown)を削除しました。大亮院殿橒嶺道峻大居士 は読み方不明です。

sen.j: 墓所：滋賀県高島市大溝の円光寺。
sen.e: His grave is located in Enko-ji Temple in Omizo, Takashima City, Shiga Prefecture.
Graveyard: Enko-ji Temple in Omizo, Takashima City, Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 他の項目での表記及び上記の表記に合わせ、”コロン”で表記しました。
sen.e: Graveyard: Enko-ji Temple in Omizo, Takashima City, Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
